image.altText: Man in a blue suit with glasses reads speech

items.synopsis: Senator David Van has rejected the allegations, and in a letter to party officials accused the Liberals of disregarding due process.

title.children: David Van resigns from Liberal Party following allegations of inappropriate behaviour

image.altText: A composite image of armed police and a man on a Melbourne tram

items.synopsis: Police allege the 57-year-old man had earlier stole items from a CBD business before attempting to flee on the tram.

title.children: Police storm Melbourne CBD tram after man holds passenger at knifepoint

image.altText: A group of men walk forward at a men's ceremony in Wadeye.

items.synopsis: Bruised and traumatised, resilient and proud — how the troubled outback community of Wadeye in the Northern Territory is trying to shed its violent past and move forward.

title.children: 'They all burned, all the houses': A bush town in anguish tries to heal from its violent past

image.altText: A black and white photo of a topless person from their right side.

items.synopsis: A straightforward portrait of artist Emma Armstrong-Porter with "a lot of stuff going on" underneath its simplicity is selected as this year's National Photographic Portrait Prize winner.

title.children: 'Simple' photo taken in a home studio wins 2023 National Photographic Portrait Prize

image.altText: A man with white hair and glasses smiles.

items.synopsis: John Feint has volunteered with the St Vincent de Paul Society for 16 years, and in that time started a program offering some fun to at-risk youth.

title.children: John created a program bringing Scouts and Vinnies together to support at-risk teenagers

items.synopsis: Fifteen Canberra suburbs, as well as Googong across the border, fell out of the $1 million zone over the past year — their median houses prices are now six figures.

title.children: Almost half of Canberra's houses are still worth more than $1 million despite nationwide fall in prices

image.altText: A woman holds an Airtag in her hand near her bag.

items.synopsis: Apple's Airtags and similar devices like Tile are marketed as useful tools for people to keep track of their belongings. But domestic violence awareness groups say that in the wrong hands, the devices can be used to track people against their wishes.

title.children: 'One is more horrific than the next': When women discovered they'd been stalked with Airtags, they took their fight to Apple

image.altText: Mungbeans in the dirty palm of a farmer's hand.

items.synopsis: Mung beans are one of the world's smallest vegetables. But there is a huge global market for this tiny — and valuable — crop.

title.children: Packing a gram-for-gram protein punch equal to a T-bone steak, demand for this tiny legume is booming

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at Victorian Labor Conference.

items.synopsis: The prime minister announces a $2 billion one-off investment — which will be distributed among the states and territories within the next two weeks — during a speech at the Victorian Labor Conference.

title.children: Albanese announces $2 billion investment in social housing around Australia

image.altText: a close up of king charles, wrinkled and red face with a receding grey hairline

items.synopsis: Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, author Ian McEwan and immunologist and geneticist Sir John Bell are appointed Companions of Honour as part of King Charles's birthday honours list.

title.children: King Charles appoints Anna Wintour, Ian McEwan as Companions of Honour

image.altText: Police speak to a woman at a Maylands protest for and against drag queen story time.

items.synopsis: About 200 demonstrators drown out people protesting against a storytelling event hosted by a drag artist at a library in Perth.

title.children: Counter-protesters outnumber opponents of drag queen's book-reading event at Perth library

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen look under debris in a street for booby-traps.

items.synopsis: Ukraine is covered in more landmines, booby traps and unexploded ordnance than any other country in the world. As the conflict rages on, what resources and innovations will help the de-mining community tackle the issue?

title.children: New 'jumping' explosives and booby-trapped toys. What Ukraine is facing as the world's most mined country

image.altText: a couple holding a portrait with their baby, in his nursery

items.synopsis: An internal review found Alby's death in the delivery room was a rare obstetric emergency, but his grieving parents say they are unhappy with the care they received.

title.children: The hospital said baby Alby's death was due to a 'rare obstetric emergency'. His parents want to know how it happened

image.altText: Travis Head fumbles the ball as he dives forward on the ground comically

items.synopsis: England's approach to Test cricket was always going to provide some hectic moments in the Ashes, and so it proved on day one of the first Test.

title.children: Five things we learned on day one of the Ashes as England's start stuns their skipper

image.altText: Bradley Lyons stands in front of a white wall looking straight ahead in a passport-style photograph.

items.synopsis: When Bradley Lyons lay down on his bed for an afternoon nap after working the early Sunday shift at a Lakes Entrance supermarket in December 2018, he was blissfully unaware that several people were conspiring to kill him.

title.children: Justice for young dad tortured by 'vigilantes', executed and left in a shallow grave, as seventh person is convicted

image.altText: The arrest of Joanne Warren at Huskisson in April 2020, and Joanne Warren outside the church today.

items.synopsis: A woman receives compensation from police after being wrongfully handcuffed and placed in a paddy wagon while walking by a protest to protect a heritage church on the NSW South Coast.

title.children: Woman 'thrown to the ground and arrested' by police at 'peaceful' church protest gets $60k payout

image.altText: a helicopter flies above a village and giant rock face

items.synopsis: Relieved residents of a village in south-east Switzerland say a huge rock mass, which was feared would fall and destroy their homes, has come down but stopped just short of their settlement.

title.children: Rockfall narrowly misses Swiss village

image.altText: Composite image of a woman with long hair as she looks now and short hair as she looked in the past with photos of four babies.

items.synopsis: Journalist Quentin McDermott — who secured the first interview with Kathleen Folbigg from prison — gives an insight into Australian Story's investigation of her case over 20 years.

title.children: How Australian Story's coverage of Kathleen Folbigg's case helped kickstart the scientific research that ultimately freed her

image.altText: a ref tries to break up two men involved in pushing and shoving

items.synopsis: Officials have been trying to stamp out the troubling tradition among Mexican soccer fans for years.

title.children: Homophobic chants bring early end to soccer match between US and Mexico

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield concentrates as he kicks the football

items.synopsis: Geelong captain Patrick Dangerfield joins the list of South Australians affected by the state's ramping crisis, as he is forced to wait in a ramped ambulance outside the Royal Adelaide Hospital with a partially collapsed lung and a cracked rib after sustaining an injury in Thursday night's match.

title.children: Patrick Dangerfield among patients forced to wait outside RAH as SA's ramping crisis worsens

image.altText: Fox News chyron reading, "Wannabe dictator speaks at the White House after having his political rival arrested."

items.synopsis: Alex McCaskill, a longtime producer for former Fox News host Tucker Carlson is dropped by the network after being found responsible for an on-air headline that referred to US President Joe Biden as a "wannabe dictator".

title.children: Fox News ousts former Tucker Carlson producer over headline describing Biden as 'wannabe dictator'

image.altText: Philip Lowe, wearing a dark suit, stands at a lectern in front of a large projection of a line graph

items.synopsis: There's a veritable shopping list of economic elements that will need to move in "right" direction for the RBA to stop lifting interest rates, but there's only one number that can seal the deal for cheaper borrowing costs in a concrete way, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The RBA will eventually stop raising interest rates. Here's what it will take to get to that point

image.altText: An image of a sword hilt with intricate carvings

items.synopsis: The discovery of the sword, made more than 3,000 years ago, is causing excitement, with experts saying "the state of preservation is extraordinary".

title.children: Bronze Age sword so well preserved it 'almost still shines' unearthed in Germany

image.altText: Side by side photos of politicians Lidia Thorpe, David Van, Peter Dutton and Brittany Higgins, all looking serious

items.synopsis: The way both Brittany Higgins's and Lidia Thorpe's complaints of sexual assault erupted reflected their lack of belief that Parliament House, and/or politics, would deal seriously with them, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The Coalition's political attack seems to have backfired, but it's women at the heart of allegations that suffer most

image.altText: A small brown mushroom sprouts from dark green grass

items.synopsis: While very few patients are expected to access new psychedelic therapies when regulatory changes take effect next month, medicinal cannabis companies, drug developers and health insurers are keeping watch on the emerging industry.

title.children: Rules around psychedelics are about to change, and an unsurprising player is entering the market

image.altText: Screenshot1

items.synopsis: The Sussex crowd is left in raptures as T20 Blast debutant Brad Currie takes one of the most spectacular catches in cricket history.

title.children: 'He can't quite believe it': Is this the best catch in the history of cricket?

image.altText: An Eels NRL player holds the ball with his right hand as he is tackled by two Manly opponents.

items.synopsis: Parramatta will host Manly in Western Sydney before the Tigers take on the Storm. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Eels take on Manly in Parramatta, Tigers host Storm

image.altText: Max King is in mid-air just after making contact with a kick for goal

items.synopsis: Richmond tries to keep its top eight hopes alive against St Kilda at the MCG, after the Giants bring back the 'Orange Tsunami' with a big win over the Dockers. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Tigers take on Saints in key game at the 'G, after Giants crush the Dockers

image.altText: A young, smartly dressed blonde woman has one hand on a desk, the other pointing in the air

items.synopsis: Prima Facie won the Australian playwright an Olivier, plus Jodie Comer a Tony just this week, but beyond awards, the powerful “rape play” has far-reaching implications for the law.

title.children: An outsider to the law and to theatre, Suzie Miller wrote a play that’s changing the legal system

image.altText: A man in silhouette stands near a boat on a beach, looking out to sea at during a pink and gold sunset.

items.synopsis: The mayor of Palm Island in North Queensland says the telco's arrival is "great news" for the remote Indigenous community that will create jobs and launch the island into the "corporate world".

title.children: Half of this remote island has no internet — but it is about  to host Telstra's newest call centre

image.altText: Four men involved in the search for Jennie Kehlet.

items.synopsis: As police dig up an abandoned mine shaft for clues that could shed light on the deaths of two people in WA's outback, locals conduct their own search as they try to help solve the baffling cold case mystery.

title.children: These blokes are using local outback know-how to try to solve a homicide

image.altText: A woman in a knitted jumper sits on a couch with two dogs the breed are mini labradoodle

items.synopsis: When Sonya Leeding's husband senior constable Damian Leeding was shot attending a botched robbery at a Gold Coast tavern in 2011, she became one of the state's most recognisable widows. More than 12 years on, she's finally found a way back to herself.

title.children: Sonya Leeding left behind the burden of being a 'police widow' and forged her own path as a mum and a detective

image.altText: A small marsupial mole in cupped hands

mediaThumbnail.caption: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

document.caption: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.
document.synopsis: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

synopsisAlt.sm: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

document.title: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru

titleAlt.lg: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru
titleAlt.md: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru
titleAlt.sm: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru

items.synopsis: The marsupial mole is completely blind, "swims" through the desert sand and rarely ventures above ground. But one eagle-eyed traveller is in "disbelief" after spotting one attempting to cross the road.

title.children: 'Very rarely seen' marsupial with 'silky' golden fur spotted near Uluru
